alert.note: Alert for Wheeler (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 05 at 1:15PM PDT until May 10 at 7:56AM PDT by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Pendleton OR has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Oregon... John Day River at Service Creek affecting Wheeler County. For the John Day River...including Service Creek...Moderate flooding is forecast. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/pdt. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL WEDNESDAY MORNING... ...REPLACES RIVER FLOOD WATCH... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...John Day River at Service Creek. * WHEN...Until Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 11.5 feet, * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:30 PM PDT Friday the stage was 11.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this afternoon to a crest of 12.6 feet tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 11.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 12.9 feet on 03/14/1983. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (11 am PDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sat Sun Mon John Day River Service Creek 11.5 11.3 Fri 12 pm PD 12.5 12.4 12.1 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Even 6 inches of fast-moving flood water can knock you off your feet and a depth of 2 feet will float your car. Never try to walk, swim, or drive through such swift water. If you come upon flood waters, stop, turn around and go another way. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
